author: Seory

text: Hello! Good afternoon I have been watching your game and it has caught my attention and I know you have a time and I would like to give you a new life. They don't update it anymore, they don't take patches or anything else, I could do it and I do it for FREE because it's my hobby. I have already been using Torque 3D cocretely for 5 years and I have several programming languages ​​such as C ++, TorqueScript, Java, JavaScript and C # I am also a graphic designer. I would like to contribute to the development of GIDEON / MarkOnline. If you are interested in my proposal, please tell me by comments. Thank you so much!

text:
@SupraDarky
Its a pretty fun game, but it clearly didnt go through its full development. Some of the level designs feel a bit sloppy, and require you to do things that feel like glitches. Something I am sure the dev team didnt intend.
author: bulbinking

text:
I own and have beaten this game. Its entire design is lovely, reminiscent of a children's movie. It's a very charming remake of a game I loved as a child.

If you play through, you can unlock some bonus material, like concept drawings. One of the unlockables is a video where someone on the staff dressed his toddler like the boy from this game, and had him hug a pillow, to use as inspiration for the hugging-the-blob animation in game. It's adorable.

But I digress. Excellent choice here, Supra!
